citation.article-title: Characterization of a novel Atopobium isolate from the human vagina: description of Atopobium vaginae sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Atopobium vaginae sp. nov.
Atopobium vaginae (va.gi'nae. L. n. vagina vagina ; L. gen. n. vaginae of the vagina)
Cells consist of small elongated Gram-positive cocci which occur singly, in pairs or short chains.
Tiny pinhead colonies are formed on blood agar at 37°C.
Acid is not produced from mannose or raffinose.
Arginine dihydrolase, arginine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, proline arylamidase and serine arylamidase activities are detected.
Weak activity for phenylalanine arylamidase may be detected.

Activities for alanine arylamidase, α-arabinosidase, cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, ester lipase C8, esterase C4, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-galactosidase 6-phosphate, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, glutamic acid decarboxylase, glutamylglutamic acid arylamidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase, β-N-acetylglucosaminidase, lipase C14, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, trypsin or urease are not detected.
Gelatin and aesculin are not hydrolysed.
The G+C content of DNA is 44 mol% (Tm).
Isolated from the vaginal flora of a healthy person.
